Sentencas: The common technology for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) is based on a cermet (ceramic-metal composite) anode of nickel with yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ), often used as the supporting structure.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: One of the main limitations of this technology is the tolerance of the anode towards reduction and oxidation (RedOx) cycles.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In this study, two techniques are used to quantify the anode expansion after a RedOx cycle of the nickel at different temperatures.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The first method considers the anode expansion above the electrolyte fracture limit by measuring the crack width in the electrolyte layer.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In the second method, the anode porosity is measured using scanning electron microscopy (SEM) image quantification.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The same measurement techniques are used to quantify anode expansion after consecutive RedOx cycles at constant temperature.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The quantification technique is then applied to cells tested in real stack conditions.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The cell corners can undergo several RedOx cycles depending on stack design and fuel utilization.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The study of such zones allows estimating the number of cycles that the anode experienced locally.
Titulo: RedOx study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell
